contextId.information: This represented giving a blessing and imparting responsibility and authority for the work to the seven. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
God told Moses this so he would honor God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
"God turned away." This action expresses that God was not pleased with the people and no longer helped them. AT: "God stopped correcting them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

This action expressed their strong anger at Stephen or hatred of Stephen. AT: "they became so angry that they ground their teeth together" or  "moved their teeth back and forth as they looked at Stephen."(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
put their hands over their ears to show that they did not want to hear any more of what Stephen said. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This is an act of submission to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This symbolic action shows that Peter and John wanted God to give the Holy Spirit to the believers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Ananias put his hands on Saul. This was a symbol of giving a blessing to Saul. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Although bowing was common in that culture, here Cornelius bowed to Peter as an act of worship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: bowed down at his feet to worship him

contextId.information: "laid their hands on these men whom God had set apart for his service." This act showed that the leaders agreed that the Holy Spirit had called Barnabas and Saul to do this work. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: laid their hands on these men

contextId.information: This could refer to moving his hands as a signal that he was ready to speak. AT: "moved his hands to show that he was about to speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
The jailer humbled himself by bowing down at the feet of Paul and Silas. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: fell down before Paul and Silas

contextId.information: This is a symbolic action to indicate that Paul will no longer try to teach the Jews there  about Jesus. He is leaving them to God's judgment. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

This is a symbolic action that indicates the completion of a vow. This can be stated in active form. AT: "he had someone cut off the hair on his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he had his hair cut off because of a vow he had taken

contextId.information: These actions show that the Jews there are outraged because they feel Paul has spoken against God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: throwing off their cloaks, and throwing dust into the air
